newsitem.title: USA: Little rain, mild weather in Florida citrus belt.
newsitem.headline: Little rain, mild weather in Florida citrus belt.

text.p: There was very little rain and temperatures were mild this week in Florida's citrus belt, the Florida Agricultural Statistics Service (FASS), said. These weather conditions have helped provide new growth on trees in all areas.
According to FASS, those trees that had lost foliage due to the cold conditions January 19 are showing an abundance of new growth. Picking crews are working towards winding up harvesting schedules.
Caretakers are cutting cover crops in all areas.
FASS reported an estimated 161,000 boxes of navel oranges were harvested in the week ended February 9, down from 217,000 boxes the previous week and 218,000 boxes in the week ended January 26.
An estimated 9,124,000 boxes of early and mid oranges were harvested in the week ended February 9, down from 10,214,000 boxes the prior week and 10,085,000 boxes the week ended January 26, FASS said.
